1.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, the palate or inside of the mouth; hence, the mouth itself (as the organ of speech, taste and kissing)
a cornet (as giving a clear sound) or curved horn
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, heed; by implication, purpose (sake or account); used adverbially to indicate the reason or cause
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel

2.brief: to shriek (from anguish or danger); by analogy, (as a herald) to announce or convene publicly

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

3.brief: Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)

4.brief: to reign; inceptively, to ascend the throne; causatively, to induct into royalty; hence (by implication) to take counsel
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
to have (transitively, exercise; reflexively, get) dominion
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

silver (from its pale color); by implication, money
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)

5.brief: a (male) calf (as frisking round), especially one nearly grown (i.e. a steer)
to glow or grow warm; figuratively (usually) to blaze up, of anger, zeal, jealousy
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to sow; figuratively, to disseminate, plant, fructify
to dock off, i.e. curtail (transitive or intransitive, literal or figurative); especially to harvest (grass or grain)
something that rises, i.e. a stalk of grain
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

properly, failure, i.e. nothing or destruction; usually (with preposition) without, not yet, because not, as long as, etc.

to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

pleasure; hence (abstractly) desire; concretely, a valuable thing; hence (by extension) a matter (as something in mind)

to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
Ephrajim, a son of Joseph; also the tribe descended from him, and its territory
to present (a mercenary inducement), i.e. bargain with (a harlot)
affection (in a good or a bad sense)

properly, to bore, i.e. (by implication) to wound, to dissolve; figuratively, to profane (a person, place or thing), to break (one's word), to begin (as if by an 'opening wedge'); to play (the flute)
a little or few (often adverbial or compar.)
a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire
a head person (of any rank or class)

12.brief: to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
a myriad, i.e. indefinitely, large number
a precept or statute, especially the Decalogue or Pentateuch
a form of the prefix 'k-', but used separately  as, thus, so
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery

properly, to plait or interpenetrate, i.e. (literally) to weave or (generally) to fabricate; figuratively, to plot or contrive (usually in a malicious sense); hence (from the mental effort) to think, regard, value, compute

to slaughter an animal (usually in sacrifice)
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be pleased with; specifically, to satisfy adebt
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
an offence (sometimes habitual sinfulness), and its penalty, occasion, sacrifice, or expiation; also (concretely) an offender
Mitsrajim, i.e. Upper and Lower Egypt
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again

14.brief: to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
